title: How to See Reposts on TikTok: Everything You Need to Know

steps.title: Open the TikTok app.
steps.content: Open the TikTok app. This looks like a music note with a black background. If needed, you can install TikTok or create an account .

steps.title: Tap Profile.
steps.content: Tap Profile . You can find this in the bottom-right corner of the page.

steps.title: Tap the two arrows icon.
steps.content: Tap the two arrows icon. This will be underneath your profile's bio. You'll see your reposted videos here. If you don't have any reposted videos, you'll see No videos reposted . To check an individual user's reposts, go to the user's profile. Tap the two arrows icon underneath the profile bio. The shared videos can be seen here.

steps.title: Open the TikTok app.
steps.content: Open the TikTok app. This looks like a music note with a black background. Log in if you haven't already.

steps.title: Navigate to a video you want to repost.
steps.content: Navigate to a video you want to repost. You can browse your For You page, or use the search bar to find a specific creator or tag.

steps.title: Tap the "Share" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Share" icon. This looks like a right-facing arrow on the right side of the screen. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Repost.
steps.content: Tap Repost . This will be the yellow button at the top-left corner of the pop-up menu. You can find this button underneath Send to . When you tap the post, you'll see You reposted above the creator's name. Videos you repost will be visible to your followers. To undo a repost, tap the Share button on the video again and tap Remove repost .

steps.title: Reposting lets you post another user's video onto your profile.
steps.content: Reposting lets you post another user's video onto your profile. This works similarly to X's Retweet feature. The reposted videos will be shared to your followers along with an optional comment. This is different from Stitches , which can be used to combine an existing video with a new video youâ€™re making, and Duets, which shows a video side-by-side with your added content. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Currently, you cannot see who reposted your own TikTok.
steps.content: Currently, you cannot see who reposted your own TikTok. You may visit a user's profile individually to check their reposted content, but there is no way to check through your own video. Similarly, you won't be able to see who viewed a reposted video.
